Class Renderer

java.lang.Object
io.github.game.engine.Renderer
public final class Renderer extends Object
Renderer is responsible for drawing the entire game state onto a JavaFX Canvas.

This includes:

  • The game world tiles (grass, dirt, water)
  • Crops and their growth stages
  • Player character animations (walking, hoeing)
  • Flying item pickups from tiles to the inventory
  • UI elements such as inventory, toolbar, day counter, and overlays
  • Night/day visual effects

The Renderer also handles animation updates and rendering requests via the JavaFX Platform thread.

  • Constructor Details

    • Renderer

      public Renderer(World world, Canvas canvas, Player player)
      Constructs a Renderer for the given world and canvas.

      Loads tile and crop images, player animations, and sets up the pickup callback.

      Parameters:
      world - the game world to render
      canvas - the JavaFX Canvas to draw on
      player - the Player object, used for animations and pickup callbacks

  • Method Details

    • requestRender

      public void requestRender()
      Requests a render on the JavaFX application thread. This ensures thread-safety for UI updates.

    • toggleControlsOverlay

      public void toggleControlsOverlay()
      Toggles the controls overlay (pause/menu) visibility. If an overlay toggle callback is set, it will be invoked (used to pause the game loop).

    • isShowingOverlay

      public boolean isShowingOverlay()
      Returns whether the controls overlay (pause menu) is currently shown.
      Returns:
      true if the overlay is visible, false otherwise

    • setOverlayToggleCallback

      public void setOverlayToggleCallback(Runnable callback)
      Sets a callback to be executed whenever the overlay visibility changes. Typically used to pause or resume the game loop.
      Parameters:
      callback - a Runnable to execute on overlay toggle

    • spawnPickup

      public void spawnPickup(String cropType, int tileX, int tileY, Image img)
      Spawns a flying item animation from a tile to the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      cropType - the type of crop ("wheat" or "tomato")
      tileX - the x-coordinate of the tile
      tileY - the y-coordinate of the tile
      img - the image of the item to animate
